Gellar's early success led to roles in various television shows and films, including the popular sitcom "Spenser: For Hire" (1986-1987) and the comedy-drama film "High Strung" (1991). However, it was her breakout role as Kendall Hart on the ABC soap opera "All My Children" (1993-1995) that solidified her status as a rising star.

In the late 1990s, Gellar landed the title role in Joss Whedon's supernatural drama series "Buffy the Vampire Slayer" (1997-2003), earning widespread acclaim and a loyal fan base. Her portrayal of Buffy Summers, a powerful vampire slayer, cemented her status as a teen icon and earned her numerous award nominations, including a Golden Globe nomination.

Gellar's film career flourished in the 2000s, with notable roles in films like "I Know What You Did Last Summer" (1997), "Cruel Intentions" (1999), "Scream 2" (1997), and "The Grudge" (2004). She also appeared in the romantic comedy "Veronika Decides to Die" (2005) and the drama "Southland Tales" (2006).

In addition to her on-screen work, Gellar is a devoted wife and mother. She married actor Freddie Prinze Jr. in 2002, and they have two children together. The couple is also involved in various philanthropic efforts, including supporting the Rape Treatment Center at Santa Monica-UCLA Medical Center.

Throughout her career, Sarah Michelle Gellar has received numerous awards and nominations, including a Daytime Emmy Award, a People's Choice Award, and a Saturn Award. Her impressive body of work has made her a beloved figure in the entertainment industry, and she remains a fan favorite to this day.
